title: Niall Horan fears Zayn Malik will snub One Direction reunion
text:

Niall Horan fears Zayn Malik would snub a One Direction reunion if the band decide to get back together.

The X Factor star, 26, insisted there are "no hard feelings" towards Zayn and that the Bradford native "is doing his own thing."

Zayn, 26, was part of the boyband when they first shot to fame in 2010 on X Factor, but quit the group in 2015.

The rest of the band decided to take a hiatus in 2016 and the break shows no sign of coming to an end.

Speaking to the Telegraph , Niall said of Zayn: "There’s no hard feelings.

"He is doing his own thing and I don’t know what would happen with Zayn if the conversation came up to get the band back together.”

(Image: Getty)

The Irish singer's comments are sure to disappoint fans who would miss Zayn if he did not take to the stage alongside the rest of the band made up of Harry Styles, Louis Tomlinson, Liam Payne and Niall.

Elsewhere in the interview, Niall admitted that the One Direction boys would have ended up killing each other if they hadn't split when they did.

The What Makes You Beautiful hitmaker shared that despite the band's huge success, they ended up having a series of bust-ups and "s****y arguments'.

(Image: Getty)

But three years after they went on hiatus, he's sparked hopes that a reunion may finally be on the cards.

He added: "I'm enjoying what I'm doing, but if one of the lads were to pick up the phone and say,'It’s time, I’d do it'."

At their peak One Direction were the biggest pop band on the planet, spawning number one albums, sell out tours and a multi-million dollar grossing movie.

After announcing their hiatus in 2015, Niall was one of the first to go solo, launching folk-inspired debut Flicker, which he has yet to follow up.

Niall's other bandmates have gone on to various degrees of success since the split was announced.

(Image: PA)

Louis Tomlinson was a judge on last year's X Factor and went on to win the show mentoring singer Dalton Harris.

While Harry Styles' self-titled debut album topped the UK and US charts. The 25-year-old also delved into acting with a part in award-winning movie Dunkirk in 2017.

Liam Payne, 25, signed a deal with Republic Records in 2016, with lead single Strip That Down being certified platinum in both the UK and US.

Zayn Malik, who left the group in 2015 to go solo, has embraced a a more alternative R&B sound than his former bandmates and collaborated with US rappers including Lil Wayne and PartyNextDoor.

He released second album Icaraus Falls in 2017
